humanum_full_description_en:
"Shuowen" is made " 𧧢 ", from " yan " to "巟" sound. Later it was written as " lie ", from the sound of " words " and " wildness ". " Huang " is also from the sound of " Sang ". Xu Shen regards the original meaning as Mengyan, but this usage is not seen in ancient books. "Shuowen": "𧧢, dream words. Congyan, 巟声."

" Lie " often means lies and lies. For example, Guan Hanqing in Yuan Dynasty's "Boudoir Resents the Beautiful Lady Worshiping the Moon Pavilion": "Wu's husband and wife Sanxieyue time, you never saw your gangster tell a lie." Ming Dynasty Wu Chengen "Journey to the West" Chapter 32: "Look at this pig Go, never patrol the mountains, nor dare to see the monsters. I don't know where to go for a while, and I will lie and coax us."

" Lie " can be used as a verb to deceive. For example, the fourth fold of the fifth book of "The Story of the West Chamber" by Wang Shifu in the Yuan Dynasty: "Zhang Sheng had never been a son-in-law. It was Zheng Heng who lied and waited for him to prove it." Tang Xianzu of the Ming Dynasty "Peony Pavilion. Secret Discussion: "After Master Du went, he lied to a lot of people, including the scholars, people and people in the county, and set up a shrine for health."

" Lie " also means falsehood. For example, in the 99th episode of Li Ruzhen's "Jing Hua Yuan" in the Qing Dynasty: "Cooks love to tell lies, all must be checked for him." Lao She's "Two Horses" third paragraph one: "The movie is like that, the play is like that. This novel is like that, even if there are 50% of lies, isn't there still 50% of true?"

humanum_full_description:
《說文》作「𧧢」，從「言」，「巟」聲。後寫作「謊」，從「言」，「荒」聲。「荒」亦從「巟」聲。許慎以為本義是夢言，但古書中未見此用法。《說文》：「𧧢，夢言也。从言，巟聲。」

　　「謊」常表示謊話、假話。如元代關漢卿《閨怨佳人拜月亭》：「兀的做夫妻三箇月時光，你末不曾見您這歹渾家說箇謊。」明代吳承恩《西遊記》第32回：「你看豬八戒這一去，決不巡山，也不敢見妖怪，不知往那裡去躲閃半會，捏出個謊來，哄我們也。」

　　「謊」可作動詞，表示哄騙。如元代王實甫《西廂記》第五本第四折：「張生並不曾人家做女婿，都是鄭恒謊，等他兩箇對證。」明代湯顯祖《牡丹亭．秘議》：「便是杜老爺去後，謊了一府州縣士民人等許多分子，起了個生祠。」

　　「謊」還表示虛假。如清代李汝珍《鏡花緣》第99回：「廚子最愛開謊帳，全要替他核對明白。」老舍《二馬》第三段一：「篇篇電影是那樣，出出戲是那樣，本本小說是那樣，就算有五成謊吧，不是還有五成真的嗎？」
